definition: interest in dallying/in the mood for playing
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
variant of 玩[wan2]/Taiwan pr. [wan4]
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
surname Xing

sentences.english: Playfulness, as a concept of psychology, has special meaning.
sentences.chinese: 玩兴，作为一个心理学的概念，具有特定的含义。

sentences.english: Playfulness, spare elegance, and wit epitomize the poetry of Billy Collins.
sentences.chinese: 玩兴，备用优雅，机智的缩影比利柯林斯诗歌。

definition: mood/spirits/interest
keen interest/concentrated attention
refined and elegant attitude of mind
to tease/to provoke/to play with (a child, animal etc)
to be laughing and playing/to giggle
interest in wine/passion for drinking
to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
to play
interest/taste
naughty
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to tease/to poke fun at
tipsy feeling
variant of 興高采烈|兴高采烈[xing4 gao1 cai3 lie4]
to have lost interest/to have had enough
to provoke/to tease
